author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Madras High Court on Monday passed an interim order directing the State government to allow applications moved by over 7,000 Class 10 students seeking exemption from writing Tamil language exam, which was made mandatory subsequent to the enactment of Tamil Nadu Tamil Learning Act in 2006.

The First Bench of Chief Justice S.K. Kaul and Justice M. Sathyanarayanan granted the interim relief while hearing a batch of writ petitions by students whose mother-tongue is other than Tamil.

“We have no option, but for the time being, to exempt all the candidates, who have sought exemption from taking the Tamil examination,” the Bench said.
title: Exempt class X students from writing Tamil exam: HC
